cot.cot_output:
Reasoning process:
1. During the New Kingdom of ancient Egypt (1550-1070 BCE), there were several important religious figures.
2. One of the most important new religious figures of the New Kingdom was the pharaoh Akhenaten.
3. Akhenaten is known for his religious revolution, during which he promoted the worship of the sun disc, Aten, as the supreme deity and attempted to suppress the worship of other gods.
4. His religious reforms had a significant impact on Egyptian society and religious practices during the New Kingdom.

Answer:
The most important new religious figure of the New Kingdom of ancient Egypt was Pharaoh Akhenaten.
